Description of column contents: The neutral, monoisotopic mass of a feature. Submitted values should have an appropriate number of decimal places relative to the measurement technique (e.g., at least four for HRMS data)
Additional comments: Only a single Mass or m/z column should be included. If Mass is included, m/z should not be. This mass should be reflective of any upstream data processing software or tools that were used to identify adducts/multimers/other ion forms

Description of column contents: The measured mass-to-charge (m/z) value of a feature. This value should have an appropriate number of decimal places relative to the measurement technique (e.g., at least four for HRMS data)
Additional comments: Only a single Mass or m/z column should be included. If m/z is included, Mass should not be. The m/z value will not be reflective of any already identified adducts/multimers/other ion forms from upstream processing

Acceptable column names: Retention_time, Retention_Time, RETENTION_TIME, rt, RT, Ret._Time
Description of column contents: The measured retention time of a feature. This value should be given in units of minutes and have an appropriate number of decimal places relative to the measurement technique (e.g., one or two for LC data)

Acceptable column names: For blanks used for MRL determination and blank subtraction: MB, mb, mB, Mb, BLANK, Blank, blank
Description of column contents: The measured response of features in each sample or bank, typically given as an integrated peak area. Both empty cells and cells with “0” are treated as non-detects
Additional comments: Sample and blank replicates are identified by separation of a single character, for example, ‘My_Sample_a’ and ‘My_Sample_b’, or “Blank_a” and “Blank_b”. If any blank (e.g., solvent blank) is not desired to used be for MRL determination and blank subtraction, ensure none of the “acceptable column names” are used. Sample responses should not be imputed, normalized, or otherwise transformed prior to INTERPRET NTA processing
